replies.bodyText: Might want to micro-benchmark this if perf is a concern. I like the readability of @felixdesouza's suggestion.
replies.author: jeremyk-91

timeline.bodyText: might it be clearer if you said rawBytes.length - (endOfTableName + 1)? not particularly fussed here
timeline.author: felixdesouza

timeline.bodyText: nit: containsExactlyInAnyOrderElementsOf as opposed to isEqualTo is probably what we care about? There could be something I'm missing.
timeline.author: jeremyk-91

replies.bodyText: Since the return type is a list, I'd say the ordering is implicitly guaranteed (although not explicitly specified)
